newsitem.title: USA: Senior IMF official expects gold sales agreement.
newsitem.headline: Senior IMF official expects gold sales agreement.

text.p: A senior International Monetary Fund official said he expects the organization's board to back the sale of IMF gold if needed to help aid poor nations.
"We expect to get an agreement that in the event of need the board will be willing to sell gold," he told a news conference unveiling the IMF's 1996 annual report.
Speaking to Reuters Financial Television later, Fischer said that an agreement was "not totally in the bag" but looked very likely.

The IMF's board is scheduled to meet on Friday to discuss the possible sale of some five million ounces of the IMF's gold. A handful of nations -- led by Germany -- have opposed the proposal, although most back it.
Fischer said that the IMF was concerned about Germany's objections and was working with it to try to fashion an agreement.
But, he said, "I'm not sure in the end we will be able to fully agree with them," indicating a willingness to go ahead with the proposal without German support.

Asked about rumors that the IMF was negotiating with some central banks about purchasing the gold directly so as not to upset the market, Fischer replied, "There have been early discussions on how to sell the gold."But he added, "I'm not aware that we've come anywhere close to deciding."
The IMF in the past has sold gold through public auction.
